properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 12 at 6:42AM CST until February 12 at 9:45AM CST by NWS Fort Worth TX
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Fort Worth has issued a

* Flood Advisory for...
Dallas County in North Texas...

* Until 945 AM CST.

* At 639 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated moderate to heavy rain that
will cause urban and small stream flooding. Numerous traffic
cameras across the area indicated that several major thoroughfares
including but not limited to the Interstate 30 and Interstate 45
junction near downtown Dallas are experiencing minor flooding.
Several city of Dallas Alert gauges suggest minor flooding of low-
lying areas. Areas that experience poor drainage are will likely
experience flooding in the advisory area.

* Some locations that will experience flooding include...
Dallas, Garland, Irving, Grand Prairie, Mesquite, Carrollton,
Richardson, Rowlett, Desoto, Grapevine, Cedar Hill, Wylie, Coppell,
Duncanville, Lancaster, Farmers Branch, Balch Springs, University
Park, Sachse and Seagoville.
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of small
creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as
well as other drainage areas and low lying spots.

A Flood Advisory means river or stream flows are elevated, or ponding
of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
